save_flows.name: save_flows
save_flows.longname: save calculated flows to budget file
save_flows.description: keyword to indicate that IST flow terms will be written to the file specified with ""BUDGET FILEOUT"" in Output Control.

budget.name: budget
budget.description: keyword to specify that record corresponds to the budget.

fileout.name: fileout
fileout.description: keyword to specify that an output filename is expected next.

budgetfile.name: budgetfile
budgetfile.description: name of the binary output file to write budget information.

budgetcsv.name: budgetcsv
budgetcsv.description: keyword to specify that record corresponds to the budget CSV.

budgetcsvfile.name: budgetcsvfile
budgetcsvfile.description: name of the comma-separated value (CSV) output file to write budget summary information.  A budget summary record will be written to this file for each time step of the simulation.

sorption.name: sorption
sorption.description: is a text keyword to indicate that sorption will be activated.  Use of this keyword requires that BULK_DENSITY and DISTCOEF are specified in the GRIDDATA block.  The linear sorption isotherm is the only isotherm presently supported in the IST Package.

first_order_decay.name: first_order_decay
first_order_decay.description: is a text keyword to indicate that first-order decay will occur.  Use of this keyword requires that DECAY and DECAY_SORBED (if sorption is active) are specified in the GRIDDATA block.

zero_order_decay.name: zero_order_decay
zero_order_decay.description: is a text keyword to indicate that zero-order decay will occur.  Use of this keyword requires that DECAY and DECAY_SORBED (if sorption is active) are specified in the GRIDDATA block.

cim.name: cim
cim.longname: initial concentration of the immobile domain
cim.description: initial concentration of the immobile domain in mass per length cubed.  If CIM is not specified, then it is assumed to be zero.

cimfile.name: cimfile
cimfile.description: name of the output file to write immobile concentrations.  This file is a binary file that has the same format and structure as a binary head and concentration file.  The value for the text variable written to the file is CIM.  Immobile domain concentrations will be written to this file at the same interval as mobile domain concentrations are saved, as specified in the GWT Model Output Control file.

print_format.name: print_format
print_format.longname: keyword to indicate that a print format follows
print_format.description: keyword to specify format for printing to the listing file.

columns.name: columns
columns.description: number of columns for writing data.

digits.name: digits
digits.description: number of digits to use for writing a number.

format.name: format
format.description: write format can be EXPONENTIAL, FIXED, GENERAL, or SCIENTIFIC.

thetaim.name: thetaim
thetaim.description: porosity of the immobile domain specified as the volume of immobile pore space per total volume (dimensionless).

zetaim.name: zetaim
zetaim.longname: mass transfer rate coefficient between the mobile and immobile domains
zetaim.description: mass transfer rate coefficient between the mobile and immobile domains, in dimensions of per time.

decay.name: decay
decay.description: is the rate coefficient for first or zero-order decay for the aqueous phase of the immobile domain.  A negative value indicates solute production.  The dimensions of decay for first-order decay is one over time.  The dimensions of decay for zero-order decay is mass per length cubed per time.  Decay will have no effect on simulation results unless either first- or zero-order decay is specified in the options block.

decay_sorbed.name: decay_sorbed
decay_sorbed.description: is the rate coefficient for first or zero-order decay for the sorbed phase of the immobile domain.  A negative value indicates solute production.  The dimensions of decay_sorbed for first-order decay is one over time.  The dimensions of decay_sorbed for zero-order decay is mass of solute per mass of aquifer per time.  If decay_sorbed is not specified and both decay and sorption are active, then the program will terminate with an error.  decay_sorbed will have no effect on simulation results unless the SORPTION keyword and either first- or zero-order decay are specified in the options block.

bulk_density.name: bulk_density
bulk_density.description: is the bulk density of the aquifer in mass per length cubed.  bulk_density will have no effect on simulation results unless the SORPTION keyword is specified in the options block.

distcoef.name: distcoef
distcoef.description: is the distribution coefficient for the equilibrium-controlled linear sorption isotherm in dimensions of length cubed per mass.  distcoef will have no effect on simulation results unless the SORPTION keyword is specified in the options block.
